11001.bart_summary: Accused murderer Gable Tostee will remain behind bars for dangerous driving charges. The 29-year-old was four times over the legal limit when he incited a high speed police chase as he drove two passengers home to the Gold Coast from Splendour in the Grass, a music festival at Byron Bay. The incident was two weeks before New Zealand woman Warriena Tagpuno Wright fell to her death from the 14th storey balcony of his Surfers Paradise apartment. Judge Martin Blackmore dismissed his appeal for early release. He will be eligible for parole on August 1.
